meanings.definition: Capable of being recognized or distinguished.
meanings.sent1: The unique pattern on the butterfly's wing made it easily identifiable.
meanings.sent2: The suspect wore a distinctive hat that made him easily identifiable in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The detective found it amusing how the criminal's attempt to disguise himself was still identifiable.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a beacon, easily identifiable even in a noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The bright red mailbox was so identifiable that it became a landmark in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Able to be identified or known.
meanings.sent1: The missing dog had a collar with an identifiable tag.
meanings.sent2: The handwriting was so unique that it was easily identifiable as the teacher's.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how the cat's meow was so identifiable, even from a distance.
meanings.sent4: The scent of fresh bread was identifiable from blocks away, drawing people to the bakery.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the train whistle was so identifiable that it brought back memories of childhood.
